[{'created': '2014-10-27 21:38:45.000000000', 'files': ['specs/template.rst'], 'message': "Add commit message prefix to instructions.

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/oslo/2014/oslo.2014-10-24-16.07.log.html

commit_message:
Add commit message prefix to instructions.

As was discussed in the Oslo meeting 2014-10-24, we're going to
ask committers to prefix commit messages with the name of the lib
their spec relates to.  See the discussion starting around 16:20
in the meeting minutes from that day:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/oslo/2014/oslo.2014-10-24-16.07.log.html

Change-Id: I944a3006850d518cff1497d2de213d1584471ef1

commit_message:
Tie pub vip with public gw ping

Add new pacemaker cloned "ping" primitive and tie it with public
vip via "location" in order to migrate public VIP in case
controller can't ping public gateway.

Partial-bug: 1370510
Change-Id: Ibf4fedee536ac9eb106206060b58a6039558ef85
(cherry picked from commit 04b2df08b0717d7b091a9a3425d4c6af979afbd3)

commit_message:
export DIB_ROOT_LABEL to make it global

It is needed by the debian element in the root.d phase. (enviroment.d variables are not available after the base image is built)

Change-Id: Idb8f9795a619687569bcb0de774c87333d11b292
Closes-Bug: #1384103

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 5 (for juno).
 - switch to stackforge namespace.

commit_message:
Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 5 (for juno).
 - switch to stackforge namespace.
 - relax pe version_requirement to 3.x.

Change-Id: I116ea888e4be8d791994573b57bc0b3ef9560804

commit_message:
Fix problem with Ceilometer Swift pollsters for RadosGW

When RadosGW is used as Swift backend, Swift pollsters
didn't work, because RadosGW has different endpoint
from native Swift. In this case, Ceilometer should check
parameter 'swift_rados_backend' and choose correct endpoint

Change-Id: If27a62da8f849868848a4e7ab62a275b0a0d323d
Closes-Bug: #1352861

commit_message:
Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 5 (for juno).
 - switch to stackforge namespace.
 - relax pe version_requirement to 3.x.

Change-Id: I9c83b577887210486fa03ed358910e129069a57c

LVM backed images are already available as block devices

commit_message:
Adding NoopMounter for LVM backed images.

LVM backed images are already available as block devices
and thus do not need to be mounted to nbd or loopback
devices. So, that step is skipped and the LVM device is
mounted directly to the instance's rootfs directory.

Change-Id: I31d1ccdada348589fbd5aa66417ef5013fc05835
Closes-bug: 1287754

commit_message:
Add node-set-maintenance command

This command accepts an optional reason and calls the new
/nodes/uuid/maintenance endpoint to set and clear maintenance
mode and maintenance reason.

It will reject setting maintenance mode to off with a reason,
as setting maintenance mode to off clears the reason.

Change-Id: I04e14bc239b343d8791747963e4feec1e2cbdda8
Implements: blueprint maintenance-reason

commit_message:
Swift Multi-tenant store: Fix image download

Image download returns an E500 as the token is not being
passed to the swift client.

Change-Id: Ic8a5f44088990fd8f6290a5622b823f59ef365fc
Closes-bug: #1385207

Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 5 (for juno).
 - switch to stackforge namespace.
 - relax pe version_requirement to 3.x.

Change-Id: If1c15386b92c7fc9f9bbd3311f6417bde21d2f2f

commit_message:
Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 5 (for juno).
 - switch to stackforge namespace.
 - relax pe version_requirement to 3.x.

Change-Id: I772f187071e6ea082ff36281b405eac265009323

commit_message:
Put nodes-related API in same section

The documentation for our web API (v1) has the nodes-related API
in three different sections: Nodes, NodeStates, and BootDevice.
This makes it difficult to find all the available nodes-related
API.

This puts all the nodes-related API in the same Nodes section,
removing the NodeStates and BootDevice sections.

The ConsoleInfo class/type is included in the documentation as well.

Change-Id: I3bdcb2df13861d3a098b1880062b8115855c28b6
Closes-Bug: #1386291

Ironic API supports pagination and limit the number of items returned
by the API based on a config option, by default a max of 1000 items is
returned per request. The Ironic client library by default respect that
limit, so when the Nova Ironic driver list the nodes it might hit that
limit and the wrong information will be passed to nova.

This patch fix the problem by passing a "limit=0" flag to the client
library to tell it to continue pagination until there're no more nodes
ot be returned.

commit_message:
Ironic: Continue pagination when listing nodes

Ironic API supports pagination and limit the number of items returned
by the API based on a config option, by default a max of 1000 items is
returned per request. The Ironic client library by default respect that
limit, so when the Nova Ironic driver list the nodes it might hit that
limit and the wrong information will be passed to nova.

This patch fix the problem by passing a "limit=0" flag to the client
library to tell it to continue pagination until there're no more nodes
ot be returned.

Change-Id: I63795e2b4de828fa41e97812e99a714f04d2f580
Closes-Bug: #1367349

commit_message:
Revert "Switch Nova to use oslo.concurrency"

This patch made unit tests stop running (always runs 0 unit tests) we
should revert and put a check in place to prevent that from happening
so that we don't regress the rest of Nova trying to figure out the
oslo.concurrency issue.

This reverts commit 382294762b08abb1921a77b00608ac941478ce05.

Change-Id: I98b04ac2a0ba67ba8af44867799317fdf95b8aff

commit_message:
error if we don't run any tests

This makes subunit-trace error out if it finds that there were no test
results in the subunit stream. This guards against the case where
something breaks the test toolchain and we stop running tests
entirely. Copied over from equivalent code in Tempest where this has
served us well.

Change-Id: I765395335a68dfc7eb754317f8c45c3dfdd85949

commit_message:
Properly process plugin attributes in default handler

Patch fixes default workflow from CLI, which is:
fuel attributes --env 1 --default
Gets you default attributes for your env, then you are able
to enable/disable plugin and
fuel attributes --env 1 --upload
Upload them back

related to blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

Change-Id: I805d53f5adfefca4c72662c143d9a5474a98e862

commit_message:
Add cli commands to interact with plugins

- List all plugins installed
fuel plugins
fuel plugins --list

- Install plugin
fuel plugins --install /tmp/sample.pb
1. Extracts metadata from plugin tar
2. If plugin successfully registered in nailgun
3. Untar all the files in /var/www/nailgun/plugins

- If you want to update plugin when it is already installed
  add --force flag
fuel plugins --install /tmp/sample --force
The procedure is the same as for simple install, but
if plugin already registered - it will try to update
(send PUT request)

- Refactored tests to allow writing unit tests, with mock
  and all that goodness

related to blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

Change-Id: I642a300abcb9c50ef5039a343064f2ac78e39cd8

commit_message:
Revert "Add keystone v3 CLI support"

This reverts commit e3d356476be376ebd3dfb3e84f379e113e5efac7.

This commit breaks normal usage of ironicclient as shown in the
linked bug.

The commit also removed the 'timeout' and 'insecure' options,
seemingly for no reason.

Conflicts:
	ironicclient/tests/test_shell.py

Change-Id: I780b0c00a41e77ad7b68fd1215ba8d020c96757b
Partial-Bug: 1386454

commit_message:
Switch to oslo.concurrency

Nova has removed nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py and switched to
oslo.concurrency so we can no longer import lockutils from the nova
tree.

Make the same switch in the ironic tree.

Closes-Bug: #1386631
Change-Id: I8db99d61dbe6c50c9edae37077242e2696bc5671

commit_message:
Fix python-ironicclient crash

- ca_file, cert_file and key_file arguements were renamed part of
  e3d35647 but the commit e3d35647 never renamed the other place this
  variables were used.
- This commit properly renames those variables back to sane values and
  fixes the crash

Change-Id: I7b40b2e6a314abc734d28b76626f09f3d31c0d8b
Closes-Bug: 1386454

expanding list of urls on which requests are performing.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-16 01:48:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Strip comments before checks

Strip comments before running checks.  I noticed this because devstack
uses '``foo``' to describe parameters in some places, and it's
triggering the $( check.

Unfortunately, I can see that '#' might be used within a command (git
references, etc) when it isn't actually a comment.  But short of
turning this into a complete command-parser, I'm not sure how we can
avoid that.

Change-Id: Ib402cc47a3eab63d6220874b4c8e3d4b89c8ce61
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-10-16 02:28:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Strip comments before checks

Strip comments before running checks.  I noticed this because devstack
uses '``foo``' to describe parameters in some places, and it's
triggering the $( check.

Unfortunately, I can see that '#' might be used within a command (git
references, etc) when it isn't actually a comment.  But short of
turning this into a complete command-parser, I'm not sure how we can
avoid that.

Change-Id: Ib402cc47a3eab63d6220874b4c8e3d4b89c8ce61
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-10-16 08:53:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Strip comments before checks

Strip comments before running checks.  I noticed this because devstack
uses '``foo``' to describe parameters in some places, and it's
triggering the $( check.

We strip after '# ' (note the space) to avoid catching common shell
idioms such as '${#foo}' or git references.  This isn't perfect, but
short of turning this into a complete command-parser I'm not sure how
we can avoid that.

Change-Id: Ib402cc47a3eab63d6220874b4c8e3d4b89c8ce61
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-10-17 01:36:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Strip comments before checks

triggering the $( check.

We strip after ' #' as the simplest form matching the bash rules as
mentioned in the comments.

Change-Id: Ib402cc47a3eab63d6220874b4c8e3d4b89c8ce61

commit_message:
Strip comments before checks

Strip comments before running checks.  I noticed this because devstack
uses '``foo``' to describe parameters in some places, and it's
triggering the $( check.

We strip after ' #' as the simplest form matching the bash rules as
mentioned in the comments.

Change-Id: Ib402cc47a3eab63d6220874b4c8e3d4b89c8ce61

commit_message:
labs: remove instructions for building single nodes

Building single nodes will often yield unexpected results. Regular users
should just (re)build the whole cluster.

Change-Id: Ia09cd1cfbd86db61cafcebe91458fcd759aabfc5

Change-Id: I12d6e6889fdf6da6d90695a7168721687beb4f2b

commit_message:
labs: remove quotation marks from snapshot names

The quotation marks around the snapshot names ended up as part of the
snapshot names on Linux. With the current code, removing the quotation
marks means that introducing whitespace into snapshot names would break
the Windows batch scripts.

Change-Id: I12d6e6889fdf6da6d90695a7168721687beb4f2b

subject: labs: remove Vagrant files
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7007, 'name': 'Pranav Salunke', 'email': 'dguitarbite@gmail.com', 'username': 'dguitarbite'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-28 10:42:22.000000000', 'files': ['labs/scripts/vagrant/compute.sh', 'labs/config/deploy.vagrant', 'labs/scripts/vagrant/run_scripts.sh', 'labs/scripts/vagrant/network.sh', 'labs/Vagrantfile', 'labs/scripts/vagrant/controller.sh', 'labs/scripts/vagrant/allinone.sh'], 'message': 'labs: remove Vagrant files

This patch removes the files used by Vagrant to use the labs scripts.

Vagrant support is currently broken. The most pressing issue is that
some OpenStack software needs the VM rebooted after the distro software
updates, but doing that with Vagrant would take an extra effort. Same
goes for adding snapshots.

The presence of Vagrant-specific files confused quite a few people who
gained the impression that it is a requirement when it has always been
an alternative to osbash.

If there is sufficient interest in Vagrant support, we can add it back
later.

Change-Id: I7edfac1bb7c657d30acda0605a078c39d5fa997a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
labs: remove Vagrant files

This patch removes the files used by Vagrant to use the labs scripts.

Vagrant support is currently broken. The most pressing issue is that
some OpenStack software needs the VM rebooted after the distro software
updates, but doing that with Vagrant would take an extra effort. Same
goes for adding snapshots.

The presence of Vagrant-specific files confused quite a few people who
gained the impression that it is a requirement when it has always been
an alternative to osbash.

If there is sufficient interest in Vagrant support, we can add it back
later.

Change-Id: I7edfac1bb7c657d30acda0605a078c39d5fa997a

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-24 01:37:51.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/os/glance.py'], 'message': "Correct CA cert argument for glanceclient

Heat need to pass the CA cert to glanceclient to load image data
during stack creation when glance api is configured with SSL.
Currently the client is passing the wrong cert key to glanceclient.
The key should be 'cacert' instead of 'ca_file'.

Change-Id: Ie542dda1354776e62507240c917c1cffbc222f17
Closes-Bug: #1384626
(cherry picked from commit fa7fd9d9882baf028efe0807840a4a8180cc9b9c)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Correct CA cert argument for glanceclient

Heat need to pass the CA cert to glanceclient to load image data
during stack creation when glance api is configured with SSL.
Currently the client is passing the wrong cert key to glanceclient.
The key should be 'cacert' instead of 'ca_file'.

Change-Id: Ie542dda1354776e62507240c917c1cffbc222f17
Closes-Bug: #1384626
(cherry picked from commit fa7fd9d9882baf028efe0807840a4a8180cc9b9c)

commit_message:
Added base classes for Load Tests and profiler

* added nailgun profiler
* added base clases for load test
* added integration tests

Tests are run only when teh are set in settings
(PERFORMANCE_PROFILING_TESTS) is set on True, also profiler runs
only when this variable is set. All artifacts from profiler are
writen in /tmp/nailgun_load_tests/results/, directory can be
changed in settings.yaml.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I2be46c2a0a51544b12a1d9f2a840d4edc3ede2c4
Blueprint: 100-nodes-support

commit_message:
fix make_test_event_data to work with postgres

postgres does not properly cast a uuid into text field. this patch
casts the value before recording it to db.

Closes-Bug: #1386356
Change-Id: Id9c16cf4fc3e582e79e8dab789dcd385b2bdcb66

commit_message:
Fix columns migrating for PostgreSQL

Columns generated in event table and t_datetime in
trait table shouldn't be type of double precision.

Change-Id: Ib9c5c8de034b5d1ccaa070b6de7c0d682160200c
Closes-Bug: #1337851

commit_message:
Add floating ip status to table

There is missing ability to see Floating IP status in Horizon
The ability exist in CLI and was enhanced by
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/fip-op-status
This patch add the missing attribute to the floating ip table.

Change-Id: Ic64624422a6e1dce828b329eac9938bafabb84bf
Closes-bug: #1323604

instead of ``python setup.py test``.

Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}]

[{'created': '2014-10-27 15:58:16.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_update.py', 'update.py'], 'message': 'implement -s / --soft-update flag

This provides a new flag to update.py which allows for a "soft
update", which updates all the requirements found in g-r to the g-r
specified versions, but lets any unknown lines pass through as is,
without warning. This makes the tool usable for ecosystem projects
that want to test with g-r versions of the g-r specified dependencies,
but also want to be able to add their own dependencies above and beyond.

Change-Id: I1f195ef9ff1509659848e14ec9936ff6f66a6496
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
implement -s / --soft-update flag

This provides a new flag to update.py which allows for a "soft
update", which updates all the requirements found in g-r to the g-r
specified versions, but lets any unknown lines pass through as is,
without warning. This makes the tool usable for ecosystem projects
that want to test with g-r versions of the g-r specified dependencies,
but also want to be able to add their own dependencies above and beyond.

Change-Id: I1f195ef9ff1509659848e14ec9936ff6f66a6496

subject: Use docstrings for attributes in api/controllers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7711, 'name': 'Yuriy Zveryanskyy', 'email': 'yzveryanskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'yuriyz'}, {'_account_id': 8106, 'name': 'Haomeng,Wang', 'email': 'wanghaomeng@gmail.com', 'username': 'whaom'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-27 21:47:21.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/port.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/__init__.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/collection.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/driver.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/chassis.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/base.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/link.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/root.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/state.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': "Use docstrings for attributes in api/controllers

We're using one double-quote for delimiting the strings that describe
attributes. If the string spans more than one line, only the first line
is used when sphinx generates the documentation. eg, for last_error, the
generated documentation shows:
  Any error from the most recent (last) asynchronous transaction that

instead of
  Any error from the most recent (last) asynchronous transaction that
  started but failed to finish.

Using the docstring (three double-quotes) syntax addresses this. All the
attributes in api/controllers were modified accordingly. This makes them
consistent so that any additions/changes to these strings in the future
will appear in the generated documentation as expected. (As opposed to
only changing the ones that span more than one line.)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/webapi/v1.html

Change-Id: I84e4ba9c22827838ff31ba96a788cfc22609c8a5
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use docstrings for attributes in api/controllers

We're using one double-quote for delimiting the strings that describe
attributes. If the string spans more than one line, only the first line
is used when sphinx generates the documentation. eg, for last_error, the
generated documentation shows:
  Any error from the most recent (last) asynchronous transaction that

instead of
  Any error from the most recent (last) asynchronous transaction that
  started but failed to finish.

Using the docstring (three double-quotes) syntax addresses this. All the
attributes in api/controllers were modified accordingly. This makes them
consistent so that any additions/changes to these strings in the future
will appear in the generated documentation as expected. (As opposed to
only changing the ones that span more than one line.)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/webapi/v1.html

Change-Id: I84e4ba9c22827838ff31ba96a788cfc22609c8a5

commit_message:
Revert "Add E040: $(COMMAND) preferred over `COMMAND`"

This reverts commit 43ad17be02017ff6f86e526971fcf8dc4e94adeb.

The world is not quite ready for this (it breaks devstack completely).
We should probably have this as a non-failing warning-level (we
currently don't have the concept of warnings v errors).

Change-Id: Ife310e96fecf9fc297259d6e99ea09a5ef938a33

commit_message:
Make os-net-config depend on openvswitch

This makes sense because pretty much all our low level
networking models make use of openvswitch. Also,
you need Openvswitch to be installed (and running)
before any of the os-refresh-config hooks for
os-net-config will work.

Change-Id: Ieff88a48a1e28fa32c343ae1eeea9fec4aa3df26

commit_message:
Virt driver pinning guest vCPUs to host pCPUs

This feature aims to improve the libvirt driver so that it is
able to strictly pin guest vCPUS to host pCPUs. This provides
the concept of "dedicated CPU" guest instances.

Previously approved: juno
Change-Id: I73903460f552b50fd4f333f862d14baed83e5fab

commit_message:
Oses and nodes distribution report POC

* doc_type 'installation_struct' renamed to 'structure'
* mapping for doc_type 'sturcture' in the index 'fuel' added
* tox handled
* nodes distribution report fixed
* mapping tests added
* license text added into files
* ranges nodes report implemented
* custom analyzer for lowercased unsplitted values added

Blueprint: send-anon-usage
Change-Id: I26ab5d176d9a6cbcb1f5f12f7c2f50fadc942433

commit_message:
Add timeout for anaconda yum conf

Raises timeout from 30s to 240s so that installs
do not fail on yum operations during install under
heavy load.

Change-Id: If2a67b15beb6371979f1638d2c49ef935bfbed50
Partial-Bug: #1384510

commit_message:
Propose a suite of declarative http api tests

To improve testing of the various aspects of the HTTP API, both in
terms of coverage and readability, a suite of readable declarative
tests is proposed.

Change-Id: Id7a62f81368794624a89a6c33efd37c6a529548f

subject: Check for bash-like "for"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 8895, 'name': 'Stanislav Kudriashev', 'email': 'stas.kudriashev@gmail.com', 'username': 'skudriashev'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-21 02:34:35.000000000', 'files': ['bashate/tests/samples/for_loops.sh', 'bashate/bashate.py', 'bashate/tests/test_bashate.py'], 'message': 'Check for bash-like "for"

We are currently failing in devsatck with "do not on same line as for"
when running over some embedded awk scripts.

Bash for loops are like "for i ..." or "for ((" (note double
parenthesis) while awk loops are "for (" (note single parenthesis).
So if we see a "for" followed by a single parenthesis, filter it out
on the assumption it's an awk script.

Change-Id: I7e9f6752db09ea07e91ee240ebbcbc3275709b60
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Check for bash-like "for"

We are currently failing in devsatck with "do not on same line as for"
when running over some embedded awk scripts.

Bash for loops are like "for i ..." or "for ((" (note double
parenthesis) while awk loops are "for (" (note single parenthesis).
So if we see a "for" followed by a single parenthesis, filter it out
on the assumption it's an awk script.

Change-Id: I7e9f6752db09ea07e91ee240ebbcbc3275709b60

- KeystoneClient.authenticate: username/password must have higher priority than
  this.token -- otherwise login will send an invalid token, ignoring given user
  credentials
- Call Backbone.history.start() before any app.navigate calls are made. Still
  history.start() must be called after version was fetched for authx reasons.

KeystoneClient should always first try to use username/password and only if
they are not provided, do a fallback to this.token. Otherwise for expired
tokens login is not possible.

Related-Bug: #1375622

commit_message:
Fix KeystoneClient issue when token was expired

KeystoneClient should always first try to use username/password and only if
they are not provided, do a fallback to this.token. Otherwise for expired
tokens login is not possible.

Related-Bug: #1375622
Change-Id: Ia85278402799d7d19e0c0aee975cc986de5879f9

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-27 19:58:21.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/concurrency/lockutils.py'], 'message': "Don't use variables that aren't initialized

The code should not try to use acquire_time if it has not been
initialized to some reasonable value. This commit sets it to
none and checks that it has been set before using it in the
release method to calculate the holding time.

Change-Id: Id55d549f75a348d744f753a68e1ec298bdd25b33
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't use variables that aren't initialized

The code should not try to use acquire_time if it has not been
initialized to some reasonable value. This commit sets it to
none and checks that it has been set before using it in the
release method to calculate the holding time.

Change-Id: Id55d549f75a348d744f753a68e1ec298bdd25b33

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make lockutils a runnable script

This is needed for Nova tests as the lock directory is needed for those
tests to run. Currently - after switching to oslo.concurrency, Nova
./run_tests.sh script is completely broken without this.

Change-Id: I514754ed3b174a6d2f0aea386a91463b0199c6cd

commit_message:
Add more validation for Plugin entity

- Add jsonchema for plugin handlers
- Add additional validation of cluster-plugin compatibility
  Validates on 3 parameters:
  - cluster operating system
  - cluster mode
  - release version of cluster
- Plugin can provide UI native conditions to hide/show plugins

related to blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

Change-Id: Ic6dc24a133478bf89dfdc8f07f3fb2cfe8fdcb52

repository placed on the Fuel master node.

commit_message:
Migrate to oslo.middleware

The following oslo-incubator modules are removed:
  -middleware.base
  -middleware.catch_errors
  -middleware.correlation_id
  -middleware.debug
  -middleware.request_id
  -middleware.sizelimit

Closes-Bug: #1371701
Change-Id: I187690a3eaab97cfb80fd943d98bc4cc50b76e96

[{'created': '2014-10-05 14:46:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Network: manage neutron client better in allocate_for_instance

A neutron client only needs to be created twice in the aforementioned
mthod. The first time is for the tenant and the second, if necessary,
is for the admin. This is in the event that a port binding extension
is supported (only an adnmin user can read this).

In addition to this is a client exists then the method will make use

to reuse that client instead of creating a new one.

commit_message:
Network: manage neutron client better in allocate_for_instance

A neutron client only needs to be created twice in the aforementioned
method. The first time is for the tenant and the second, if necessary,
is for the admin. This is in the event that a port binding extension
is supported (only an admin user can read this).

In addition to this is a client exists then the method will make use
of it passing it to all internal methods called. This will enable them
to reuse that client instead of creating a new one.

Change-Id: Ia826199ea600ab55447ca4e8a78738c21b473efa
Closes-bug: #1377647

commit_message:
Update some log calls for translation and lazyness

Update log calls to use _LI and friends.
Follow oslo.i18n recommendation to use "," instead of % so that
lazy evaluation of debug messages is possible.

For details about tagging, see http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation

Partial-Bug: #1379001

Change-Id: I4aff674555945e6097283770fe77abecfebd740e

commit_message:
Remove LOG outputs from v2.1 API layer

There are some debug/audit log messages about normal API operations
in each API method, but Nova WSGI framework has already output the
similar messages. So these messages are meaningless, and this patch
removes them.
This patch removes LOG outputs of InterfaceAttachFailed cases also,
because they are already output on driver layer(vmwareapi, libvirt)
and duplicated now.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ib645d1c320e6104bad34c2d7238db399e8d1ea42

commit_message:
Add API validation schema for disk_config

This patch adds API validation schema for disk_config.

This patch also modify TestServersExtensionSchema to load
disk_config extension so that update, rebuild & resize
extension schema loading can be verified.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ib687a8e4e8b173c32bcd19e396b23fbf2f3319c6

commit_message:
Ensure test_agent_manager handles random hashseeds

Several tests in test_agent_manager.py fail when tox is run using the
hashseed 2701526934, this is down to the nature of using dictionaries
and sets in Python causing some function calls and function arguments
to be out of order. This patch fixes this by either specifying that
assert_has_calls does not need to assert the order, just that the calls
were made, or by letting the unit test get affected in the same way as
the code, e.g. add variables to a dict so they are ordered by the python
hashing algorithms in the same way as they would be in the real code.

Change-Id: If83d1f33c187eab45c2a65fd50fd70cce011c9e7
Partial-Bug: 1348818

commit_message:
Enable no-name-in-module pylint check

Add _MovedItems (from six.moves) to pylintrc ignored-modules, and adjust
one import of sqlalchemy.orm.properties.RelationshipProperty.

s.o.p.RelationshipProperty is created at import-time in a rather
exciting manner - rearranging the import in this way forces the
import-time code to be executed and seems sufficient to satisfy the
pylint static check.

Change-Id: Ic99dc2b7dfac75930a5c446ae899eaae09ee6174

commit_message:
Include 207 in http success status code RFC-4918

This patch extend the http success status code with 207.
207 status code is introduced in RFC 4918.

Some API like - Nova 'os-server-external-events' return '207'
status code in case some event are accepted out of multiple event.
To support those return code in tempest, expected_success() needs to
be extended to include '207' as success status code.

Change-Id: I0ca0c80c466b1e97873d404c575af5b4a9be07a6

commit_message:
Allow some lag for floating IP to reach a status

The current test checks the floating IP status as soon as possible
without allowing the status to converge.  This doesn't allow for the
fact that implementations don't report the new status until after
connectivity has been torn down.  There may be some expected lag that
is not allowed by the current test.

Change-Id: Icfe4bb2c40fde540bc2a6371630aa3f12dd945ff
Closes-Bug: #1381617

commit_message:
Make v2.1 tests use wsgi_app_v21 and remove wsgi_app_v3

Nova v3 API has disappeared but some tests still access v3 URLs.
This patch makes them use wsgi_app_v21 and access to v2.1 URLs.
In addition, this patch removes wsgi_app_v3 because it is not
used after this change.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ic36d86dce8a35933c15ec820b273825bb0353864

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Change-Id: I87f90b9fefbf39e92446d7724e7b8e457e114716
Partial-Bug: #1259292

subject: Make sure that tox uses python2 by default
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 612, 'name': 'Tom Fifield', 'email': 'tom@openstack.org', 'username': 'fifieldt'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7923, 'name': 'Gauvain Pocentek', 'email': 'gauvainpocentek@gmail.com', 'username': 'gpocentek'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-26 15:30:14.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Make sure that tox uses python2 by default

On Ubuntu 14.10 the tox package creates python 3 virtual environments by
default. Since our tools are not python 3 compatible, we need to force
python 2 virtual environments.

Change-Id: Id2c2129f82b3128d020db5c6500b4b7443718d13
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make sure that tox uses python2 by default

On Ubuntu 14.10 the tox package creates python 3 virtual environments by
default. Since our tools are not python 3 compatible, we need to force
python 2 virtual environments.

Change-Id: Id2c2129f82b3128d020db5c6500b4b7443718d13

subject: DB API: Pass columns_to_join to instance_get_active_by_window_joined
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-27 19:19:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'DB API: Pass columns_to_join to instance_get_active_by_window_joined

This makes the instance_get_active_by_window_joined database API
configurable for which columns should be joined from other tables,
similar to instance_get_all.

This lays the groundwork for the Instance object to pass expected_attrs
to the DB API for filtering which columns to load.

Partial-Bug: #1383469

Change-Id: I7089d732cbd06a854d47b7b9e4faf21b9ef498f1
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
DB API: Pass columns_to_join to instance_get_active_by_window_joined

This makes the instance_get_active_by_window_joined database API
configurable for which columns should be joined from other tables,
similar to instance_get_all.

This lays the groundwork for the Instance object to pass expected_attrs
to the DB API for filtering which columns to load.

Partial-Bug: #1383469

Change-Id: I7089d732cbd06a854d47b7b9e4faf21b9ef498f1

commit_message:
Added apicapi package to global-requirements.txt

This package is needed for neutron project.
Two modules in neutron project are using this package, but this package
was not added to nuetron project's requirements.txt. So added that to
nuetron project's requirements.txt and submitted the change #129563.
But change #129563 is failing in CI as 'apicapi' package is not found in
global-requirements.txt. So adding 'apicapi' to global-requirements.txt
now.

Change-Id: I550f6987cfea75a1f5e523791a406157503cef0d

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-01 07:50:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Capture 409 Conflict during expect on PUT

Similarlly to how the proxy handles 412 on PUT, we will gather 409
responses in the proxy during _connect_put_node.  Rather than skipping
backend servers that already have a synced copy of an object we will
accept their response and return 202 immediately.

This is particularlly useful to internal clients who are using
X-Timestamp to sync transfers (e.g. container-sync and
container-reconciler).  It does not however remove the use of the
pre-flight X-Newest HEAD request, but it does better expose a race
condition on concurrent uploads of the same object with the same
timestamp where one might complete uring the deep search into handoffs
triggered by the X-Newest requests.

Change-Id: I620271e88107a9d06e38f0925130e29022315ce4

commit_message:
Capture 409 Conflict during expect on PUT

Similarly to how the proxy handles 412 on PUT, we will gather 409
responses in the proxy during _connect_put_node.  Rather than skipping
backend servers that already have a synced copy of an object we will
accept their response and return 202 immediately.

This is particularly useful to internal clients who are using
X-Timestamp to sync transfers (e.g. container-sync and
container-reconciler).  It does not however remove the use of the
pre-flight X-Newest HEAD request, but it does better expose a race
condition on concurrent uploads of the same object with the same
timestamp where one might complete during the deep search into handoffs
triggered by the X-Newest requests.

Change-Id: I620271e88107a9d06e38f0925130e29022315ce4

commit_message:
Remove no_wait ovs flag from vmw_nsx 3rd party lib

The no_wait flag can trigger a race conditon with ip addr flush
if the public bridge is not yet up. Due to this race condition
the local route for the external subnet might not be added.

The patch also renames br-ex to $PUBLIC_BRIDGE in some places

Change-Id: I11335c99dba580e7ca26b0b15b0df8dead367fdc

commit_message:
Remove XML support

XML support in Neutron has always been a second class feature to the
JSON API and broken for many extensions and outputs. The XML API been marked as
deprecated for the Icehouse and Juno release and is ready for removal in
Kilo.

Change-Id: I611aa9382ba3bfb08b2970c63e83b0fdd3d2e8a4
Closes-Bug: #1380787

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-01 20:07:05.000000000', 'files': ['files/apts/qpid', 'files/rpms/qpid', 'lib/rpc_backend'], 'message': "Configure an authorized user for the QPID broker

If QPID_USERNAME is set, add the user to the QPID broker's
authentication database.  Use the value of QPID_PASSWORD as the
password for the user, prompting for a password if QPID_PASSWORD is
not set.  This requires that all clients provide this username and
password when connecting to the QPID broker, or the connection will be
rejected.

If QPID_USERNAME is not set (the default), disable QPID broker
authentication. This allows any client to connect to the QPID broker
without needing authentication.

Change-Id: Ibd79873379740930ce5f598018c1ca1fffda7c31
Closes-Bug: 1272399
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Configure an authorized user for the QPID broker

If QPID_USERNAME is set, add the user to the QPID broker's
authentication database.  Use the value of QPID_PASSWORD as the
password for the user, prompting for a password if QPID_PASSWORD is
not set.  This requires that all clients provide this username and
password when connecting to the QPID broker, or the connection will be
rejected.

If QPID_USERNAME is not set (the default), disable QPID broker
authentication. This allows any client to connect to the QPID broker
without needing authentication.

Change-Id: Ibd79873379740930ce5f598018c1ca1fffda7c31
Closes-Bug: 1272399

commit_message:
Allow some attributes for cinder storage to be configurable

Glance cookbook does not have some configurable attributes for
cinder storage backend, so add them to avoid issues when using
'glance.store.cinder.Store'.

Change-Id: Ieaff14c5c24c4cbd194c70d46d376dc7d170d946
Closes-Bug: #1384044

commit_message:
Add rabbit HA configurations

This commit will add the rabbit HA related two configurations:

commit_message:
Add the ability to activate Nova ceph without Cinder

Prior to this patch, if we wanted to boot a VM in Ceph using
libvirt_image_type we must had Cinder enabled. This patch allows you to
use libvirt_image_type without having Cinder enabled.

Change-Id: Ia61e6effc5a4ccba69f4fa48f6e9984f15bb8979
Signed-off-by: Sébastien Han <sebastien.han@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Always install latest EPEL

Having issues with the centos7 job, that seem to be because they use
an old snapshot that hasn't updated to the latest EPEL.  Thus we
re-install it to ensure we're getting the latest.

Change-Id: I7930f3e05ee953dab80b06142c17d6aa70f2c2d1

commit_message:
Add swift user and project in non-default domain

Swift has functional tests that check access controls
between users and projects in differing domains. Those tests
are currently skipped by default since swift tests are
configured to use keystone v2 API. In order for those
tests to pass when using keystone v3 API, a user and
project must be setup in a non-default domain.

This patch creates a domain, and a user and project in
that domain, in support of swift functional tests moving
to using keystone v3 API.

Changes:
lib/swift
    - create a new domain, project and user for
      swift testing
    - add new project and user credentials to swift
      test config file
    - set correct identity service url in swift test
      config file according to kesytone API version

functions-common
    - add function get_or_create_domain
    - modify get_or_create_user and get_or_create_project
      functions to optionally specify a domain

Change-Id: I557de01bf196075f2f3adcdf4dd1b43756d8a0ae

[{'created': '2014-10-25 11:05:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_keepalived.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': "Fix 'Length too long' error in neutron-dsvm-functional tests

testr is occasionally failing with 'Length too long' for
neutron-dsvm-functional test cases.

The issue is seen when the size of the testr log file size goes into MBs.

(Please see the bug comments for the details on the testr logs)

This patch fixes the issue by disabling debug logs in the tests.

Change-Id: I48fc9d14f6886f86761038ee4d106fbbe59b6890
Closes-bug: #1382579
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix 'Length too long' error in neutron-dsvm-functional tests

testr is occasionally failing with 'Length too long' for
neutron-dsvm-functional test cases.

The issue is seen when the size of the testr log file size goes into MBs.

(Please see the bug comments for the details on the testr logs)

This patch fixes the issue by disabling debug logs in the tests.

Change-Id: I48fc9d14f6886f86761038ee4d106fbbe59b6890
Closes-bug: #1382579

commit_message:
Adapt puppetlabs-postgresql to Fuel

Fuel uses a custom package name "postgresql" instead
of "postgresql94", so this value needs to be passed,
along with bindir value.

Also adapted all manifest references to postgresql::db to
postgresql::server::db.

Change-Id: I1ec329ee31ecc6edfd357329bfc84df95ecf7ddc
Closes-Bug: #1386118

Add API validation schema for cloudpipe api

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-06 21:50:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Introduce rally info list and --detailed option

1. "rally info list" command: prints a list of benchmark scenario groups,
   deploy engines & server providers available in Rally + short descriptions.

2. "--detailed" option: appends a list of benchmark scenarios to the output
   for scenario groups

    $ rally info find NovaServers --detailed
    NovaServers (benchmark scenario group).

    Benchmark scenarios:
    * NovaServers.boot_and_bounce_server               Test booting a server (...)
    * NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server               Tests booting and then (...)
    * NovaServers.boot_and_list_server                 Tests booting an image (...)
                 ...                                               ...

Change-Id: Ib954796245d12ee0aed793984233c3d36ad24ad5

   deploy engines & server providers available in Rally + short descriptions.

    * KeystoneScenario
    * KeystoneBasic
    ...

    Deploy engines:
    * DevstackEngine    Deploy Devstack cloud.
    * ExistingCloud     Just use an existing OpenStack (...)

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-10-06 22:02:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Introduce rally info list and --detailed option

1. "rally info list" command: prints a list of benchmark scenario groups,
   deploy engines & server providers available in Rally + short descriptions.

    $ rally info list
    Benchmark scenario groups:
    * KeystoneScenario
    * KeystoneBasic
    ...

    Deploy engines:
    * DevstackEngine    Deploy Devstack cloud.
    * ExistingCloud     Just use an existing OpenStack (...)
    ...

2. "--detailed" option: appends a list of benchmark scenarios to the output
   for scenario groups

    $ rally info find NovaServers --detailed
    NovaServers (benchmark scenario group).

    Benchmark scenarios:
    * NovaServers.boot_and_bounce_server               Test booting a server (...)
    * NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server               Tests booting and then (...)
    * NovaServers.boot_and_list_server                 Tests booting an image (...)
                 ...                                               ...

', 'number': 10}, {'created': '2014-10-16 21:59:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Simplify rally info syntax

1. "rally info" now does not require the "query" subcommand, e.g.:

    $ rally info boot_and_delete_server
    NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server (benchmark scenario).

    Tests booting and then deleting an image.

This has been enabled by a tricky argv preprocessing since the argparse library
seems to have no direct support of optional subparsers for positional arguments.

2. Typing just "rally info" results in a list of entities available in Rally:

    $ rally info
    Benchmark scenario groups:
    +--------------------------+------------------------------------------------------+
    | Name                     | Description                                          |
    +--------------------------+------------------------------------------------------+
    | Authenticate             | This class should contain authentication mechanism.  |
    | CeilometerAlarms         | ...                                                  |

    ...

3. "rally info" called for benchmark scenario groups now prints a list of benchmark
    scenarios available there with short descriptions.

    $ rally info NovaServers
    NovaServers (benchmark scenario group).

    Benchmark scenarios:
    * NovaServers.boot_and_bounce_server               Test booting a server (...)
    * NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server               Tests booting and then (...)
    * NovaServers.boot_and_list_server                 Tests booting an image (...)
                 ...                                               ...

commit_message:
Simplify and improve "rally info"

1. Typing "rally info list" now results in a list of entities available in Rally:

    $ rally info list
    Benchmark scenario groups:
    ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
     Name                       Description
    ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
     Authenticate               This class should contain authentication mechanism.
     CeilometerAlarms           ...

    ...

   The same info appears on just "rally info" (we've monkey-patched InfoCommands
   docstring to achieve this).

2. "rally info find" called for benchmark scenario groups now prints a list of benchmark
   scenarios available there with short descriptions.

    $ rally info find NovaServers
    NovaServers (benchmark scenario group).

    Benchmark scenarios:
    --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
     Name                                             Description
    --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
     NovaServers.boot_and_bounce_server               Test booting a server (...)
     NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server               Tests booting and then (...)
     NovaServers.boot_and_list_server                 Tests booting an image (...)

3. Minor local code & UTs improvements

Change-Id: Ib954796245d12ee0aed793984233c3d36ad24ad5

commit_message:
package-installs assumes packages have a pkg-map

Our package-installs script fails when installing a package which does
not have a pkg-map but a pkg-map file exist for the element.

Change-Id: I3dab802e23bccfc916efcc1c70c6ce6c4a9ccf67

commit_message:
Adds an option to enable broadcast replies to Dnsmasq

Adds a flag for DHCP agent configuration
to add dhcp-broadcast flag to Dnsmasq process
In order to support virtual network on top of Infiniband
Fabric, there is a requirement to receive DHCP response
via broadcast message (according to IB Spec).

DocImpact
Change-Id: I95329e535bacf14b650a8f37179ecd020b5bfafe
Closes-Bug: #1293953

commit_message:
Fixes fakes and adds version param

This patch changes the fakes interface in order to fit
better with Zaqar's client and adds the version parameter
to initialization for a more flexible benchmarking.

commit_message:
Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 5 (for juno), and deps.
 - switch to stackforge namespace.
 - relax pe version_requirement to 3.x.
 - bump vswitch module deps to 1.0.0 (future semver release)

Change-Id: I2e87acbe5dd6b6fb1681678bbf152bafa15ecac0

commit_message:
Clean up in attach_interface api(v2.1)

-remove LOG from api.
-add wsgi.response decorator.
-remove PortNotFound in delete function since compute api is calling
a cast rpc call, which can not get this exception. and together testcase
-add badrquest explantion message when call create method.
-use v2 url instead of v3 url in the unit test case.

Change-Id: Icf162119b0e8e0e66f9fda55c99b149f7df01ba4

commit_message:
Switch to metadata.json for Puppet forge releases

Since puppet 3.x, Puppet Labs Forge accept only the metadata.json file
for module description (Modulefile is now deprecated).

This patch :
 - convert the Modulefile to metadata.json.
 - bump major version to 1 (for juno).
 - switch to stackforge namespace.
 - bump vswitch module to 1.0.0 (semver release)

Change-Id: I13cba8a954215a42551963a8fdbeb387706b0e91

commit_message:
Reduce the complexity of stub_out_db_network_api()

stub_out_db_network_api' is too complex (57)

Running flake8 to check for cyclomatic complexity showed that the test
method stub_out_db_network_api() in the db/fakes.py module had a
complexity of 57. This change refactors the code to reduce that
method's complexity to 2. No functional changes are included.

Change-Id: Ieb77066ba1133eae5c201121d27a970ce040117e

commit_message:
Split agg image props isolation filter unit tests

Breaks out the unit tests for aggregate image properties isolation
filters from test_host_filters.py. In the process, we remove use of the
database and mock out the calls to db.aggregate_metadata_get_by_host(),
which results in the reduction of unit test times.

Change-Id: Ie6742fcb26364684e4a998168d14a7f29e238edb

commit_message:
Allow depth limiting git clones

Depending on how you are using devstack you probably don't need the
entire history of a project so we should allow people to specify a clone
depth to speed up the devstack process.

Change-Id: I804a5abcc80f6a81e915c0bb4dceae72486441a7
Blueprint: git-depth

commit_message:
Libvirt: Support for attaching volumes via SMB

Currently, there are Libvirt volume drivers that support
network-attached file systems such as Gluster of NFS. The purpose
of this blueprint is adding support for attaching volumes hosted
on a SMB share.

bp libvirt-smbfs-volume-support

Change-Id: I7b4b5ddad69d6e00a76f8754fff6c295ad787c08

commit_message:
labs: fix formatting in wait_for_ssh

The dots printed while waiting for the ssh server to respond are
no longer on a separate line, and the line ends with a newline.

Change-Id: Ib6c1ddaa35a35ff0a1c28f9e98d205740934c0f6

commit_message:
Pool Manager Service Changes

- Added the Pool Manager cache (including test cases)
- Added the pool_manager_status table (including test cases)
- Added the PoolManagerStatus object
- Added the PoolServer object
- Added the BackendOption object
- Added support for global and server specific backend configurations
- Added a backend driver for pool manager (BIND9)
- Stubbed out the pool manager service (including periodic_sync)

Change-Id: I3d94e5df663d2938b0e6017fe43c28c71f7a29a0

commit_message:
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin' into merge-branch

This commit merges the master neutron branch into the feature/lbaasv2
branch. This is needed to get the feature/lbaasv2 branch building again.

In creating our chef LP, unittest-app was removed from
lp-cedarish. This replaces it and restores the solum-pep.yaml
example so it works again.

commit_message:
Refactor shares client init in Tempest plugin

Class 'AltManager' was removed from Tempest project as redundant.
See: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/8a938ad1

To keep compatibility of Manila plugin for Tempest was implemented refactor,
that does following changes:

- Make use of 'Manager' class defined in Manila plugin for inheritance by
  'Altmanager' and 'AdminManager' classes.
- Remove redundant code, that duplicates logic from inherited 'Manager' class.

Change-Id: Ife174c7b6e49b20b812b02c17ca8051dd2fd6a27

[{'created': '2014-06-30 15:43:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add the docker hypervisor plugin to Nova

As of the Icehouse release, the nova-docker hypervisor plugin was removed since
so many of the Tempest tests were failing. Many of the tests were failing due
to missing APIs in docker and subsequently missing functionality in the plugin.
There has been significant progress implementing those missing features and
fixing various bugs associated with the already existing features. By adding
this plugin back to the Nova source tree, we will enable operators to more
easily manage docker containers via Nova APIs.

Change-Id: I80164ccb30a7c876fe3ac1a7109f0c725476db07
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-07-09 17:13:24.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/docker-hypervisor-plugin.rst'], 'message': "Add the docker hypervisor plugin to Nova

As of the Icehouse release, the nova-docker hypervisor plugin was removed since
so many of the Tempest tests were failing. Many of the tests were failing due
to missing APIs in docker and subsequently missing functionality in the plugin.
There has been significant progress implementing those missing features and
fixing various bugs associated with the already existing features. By adding
this plugin back to the Nova source tree, we will enable operators to more
easily manage docker containers via Nova APIs.

The main features, which were missing and are now implemented, causing many of
the Tempest test failures were as follows:

* Pause and Unpause - The API for pausing and unpausing a container was missing
in Docker as well as the hypervisor plugin. The API has now been added to
Docker and is now implemented in the plugin.

* Snapshot - This was primarily broken due to image date not staying
synchronized between Glance and the Docker registry. This has been addressed
in a bug fix to Docker; however, we continue to refactor the the Docker
hypervisor plugin and we'll start pushing Docker images directly into Glance
rather than pushing just image meta-data into Glance.

* Volume Attach and Detach - The API for adding and removing a device to Docker
is missing. There is currently a patch set posted for review, which adds the
capability to attach and detach a host device to a running docker container.
Additionally, the implementation in the hypervisor plugin has been added to
call the Docker API to add/remove a device to/from a container. This will be
merged once the Docker API has been merged.

Change-Id: I80164ccb30a7c876fe3ac1a7109f0c725476db07
", 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Add the docker hypervisor plugin to Nova

As of the Icehouse release, the nova-docker hypervisor plugin was removed since
so many of the Tempest tests were failing. Many of the tests were failing due
to missing APIs in docker and subsequently missing functionality in the plugin.
There has been significant progress implementing those missing features and
fixing various bugs associated with the already existing features. By adding
this plugin back to the Nova source tree, we will enable operators to more
easily manage docker containers via Nova APIs.

The main features, which were missing and are now implemented, causing many of
the Tempest test failures were as follows:

* Pause and Unpause - The API for pausing and unpausing a container was missing
in Docker as well as the hypervisor plugin. The API has now been added to
Docker and is now implemented in the plugin.

* Snapshot - This was primarily broken due to image date not staying
synchronized between Glance and the Docker registry. This has been addressed
in a bug fix to Docker; however, we continue to refactor the the Docker
hypervisor plugin and we'll start pushing Docker images directly into Glance
rather than pushing just image meta-data into Glance.

* Volume Attach and Detach - The API for adding and removing a device to Docker
is missing. There is currently a patch set posted for review, which adds the
capability to attach and detach a host device to a running docker container.
Additionally, the implementation in the hypervisor plugin has been added to
call the Docker API to add/remove a device to/from a container. This will be
merged once the Docker API has been merged.

Change-Id: I80164ccb30a7c876fe3ac1a7109f0c725476db07

commit_message:
Update basic environment content for Juno

I updated the basic environment content in the installation
guide for Juno as follows:

1) Collapsed database section because it only includes procedures
   for the controller. Although the diagrams show the database on
   the controller node, I added some text to remind users.
2) Reorganized sections to improve flow. For example, moving the
   security section closer to the beginning of the chapter.

Change-Id: Icd43c2530982d356067c8a77ba4a744a2c63e0e4

commit_message:
Remove project id in ViewBuilder alternate link

Clearly nobody really uses the "application/vnd.openstack.image"
links in the returned results from GET /v2/{tenant}/images
REST API call, since the link URI returned in it is wrong.

Glance URIs do *not* contain a project or tenant in the URI
structure like Nova's REST API URIs do, but _get_alternate_link()
method of the image ViewBuilder tacks it on improperly:

Change-Id: I4ccb5628569c60026a1772df0794ac0271c48db3
Closes-Bug: #1343080

commit_message:
Add deferred deletion support for volume

This patch aims to provide deferred deletion of the cinder volume
as the deferred deletion of the nova instance.

Related to blueprint volume-delete-protect

Change-Id: I4ec9fc5fec834cc7800f71b54bd815d3ec7922a2

subject: added reset_state and force_delete for backup
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 170, 'name': 'Mike Perez', 'email': 'thingee@gmail.com', 'username': 'thingee'}, {'_account_id': 1207, 'name': 'Duncan Thomas', 'email': 'duncan.thomas@gmail.com', 'username': 'duncan-thomas'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 5538, 'name': 'Rushi Agrawal', 'email': 'rushi.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'rushiagr'}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 10442, 'name': 'Masco Kaliyamoorthy', 'email': 'mkaliyam@redhat.com', 'username': 'masco'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-18 05:48:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "added reset_state and force_delete for backup

users and admin can delete the backup only if, it is in
available and error state. for any reason if it struck in
any other state, we can't remove/delete that.

for volume and snapshot admin can delete the files either
by using force-delete or by changing the state explicitly.
for backup these commands are not available.

so added force_delete and reset_state for backup only for admins.

usage of the commands from python cinder client:
backup-force-delete:
cinder backup-force-delete <backup>

Attempts forced Removal of backup(s), regardsless of state(s).

Positional arguments:
  <backup>  Name or ID of the backup to delete.

backup-reset-state:
cinder backup-reset-state [--state <state>] <backup> [<backup> ...]

Explicitly update the state of a backup.

Positional arguments:
  <backup>         Name or ID of the backup to modify.

Optional arguments:
  --state <state>  Indicate which state to assign the backup. Options include
                   available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting. If no
                   state is provided, available will be used.

Change-Id: Icc26219069773138f0b727790f94ff3aa9217c9b
Closes-Bug: #1279764
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-04-21 09:43:57.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/backup/api.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/admin_actions.py', 'cinder/tests/policy.json', 'cinder/api/contrib/backups.py', 'cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py'], 'message': "added reset_state and force_delete for backup

users and admin can delete the backup only if, it is in
available and error state. for any reason if it struck in

so added force_delete and reset_state for backup only for admins.

usage of the commands from python cinder client:
backup-force-delete:
cinder backup-force-delete <backup>

Attempts forced Removal of backup(s), regardsless of state(s).

Positional arguments:
  <backup>  Name or ID of the backup to delete.

backup-reset-state:
cinder backup-reset-state [--state <state>] <backup> [<backup> ...]

Explicitly update the state of a backup.

Positional arguments:
  <backup>         Name or ID of the backup to modify.

Optional arguments:
  --state <state>  Indicate which state to assign the backup. Options include
                   available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting. If no
                   state is provided, available will be used.

Change-Id: Icc26219069773138f0b727790f94ff3aa9217c9b
Closes-Bug: #1279764
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
added reset_state and force_delete for backup

users and admin can delete the backup only if, it is in
available and error state. for any reason if it struck in
any other state, we can't remove/delete that.

for volume and snapshot admin can delete the files either
by using force-delete or by changing the state explicitly.
for backup these commands are not available.

so added force_delete and reset_state for backup only for admins.

usage of the commands from python cinder client:
backup-force-delete:
cinder backup-force-delete <backup>

Attempts forced Removal of backup(s), regardsless of state(s).

Positional arguments:
  <backup>  Name or ID of the backup to delete.

backup-reset-state:
cinder backup-reset-state [--state <state>] <backup> [<backup> ...]

Explicitly update the state of a backup.

Positional arguments:
  <backup>         Name or ID of the backup to modify.

Optional arguments:
  --state <state>  Indicate which state to assign the backup. Options include
                   available, error, creating, deleting, error_deleting. If no
                   state is provided, available will be used.

Change-Id: Icc26219069773138f0b727790f94ff3aa9217c9b
Closes-Bug: #1279764

commit_message:
Improve share snapshots list API filtering

This change adds possibility to filter share snapshots in a lot of possible
ways.
All types of share snapshots listing were updated to support additional
filtering by:
- source share id
- usage (only used by shares, only not used or any)
- limit and offset a la pagination
And sorting by:
- key of models.ShareSnapshot
- direction (asc, desc)

Removed one related CLI test, because it requres existing entities and
absense of them causes error.

Implements blueprint improve-snapshot-list-filtering

Change-Id: Idef60ddc9f54d3b2f0bcb63097bfd1f9072a1df6

commit_message:
Put X-Timestamp in object 404 responses

This way the container reconciler can tell (sometimes) that an object
was deleted at a certain time.

Change-Id: I3a56f2367585803b82f0b254946896c34746f9ca

commit_message:
Add definition of the Integrated Release

Remove the incubation and integration process and policies as a separate
file, replacing it with a single list of policies that integrated projects
are expected to follow.

Provide an explicit description of the new Integrated Release, based on
co-dependent gating and trust rules.

Change-Id: Ie2bba43dfd7faddab7afe6b3c54261fd2c0463ed

The oslo.i18n docs say not to use the hints if the message will
ultimately be user facing:
    http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Change-Id: Id5d8e125373b7dae91293bd36c46d5a5cc3a4d2b
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Update barbican client usage

1. Update the code of creating a barbican client
due to its recent change.

2. Make the ‘barbican_disabled’ defaults to True as
the two barbican patches below are not
merged yet, which breaks solum gate.

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127313
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127865

3. Fix bugs for using shelve as the default key store.

Change-Id: Id5d8e125373b7dae91293bd36c46d5a5cc3a4d2b

commit_message:
Drop "Programs" from the charter

Remove the use of the term "program" from the TC charter, replacing it
with "project team", which has no connotation of a "theme" as program
does.

commit_message:
Blueprint for Websockify security proxy framework

This blueprint proposes a generic framework for supporting
man-in-the-middle authentication and encryption between
Websockify and the hypervisor graphics servers.  It also
proposes a reference driver for that framework for TLS
security.

Spec for blueprint websocket-proxy-to-host-security

Change-Id: I23c5a43788afcb705b0d879cf5df4b49f0aa7a67
Previously-approved: juno

[{'created': '2014-10-27 01:40:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Check for existence of screen before start/stop

Running devstack in the devstack gate environment doesn't
create a screen for the running services. This causes the start,
and stop screen functions in redstack to fail. Fix this by only
performing the start and stop functions if a screen exists.

Change-Id: I2a87e7409575d1000286a7a3742d29a9cc877a8e
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-10-27 17:52:13.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/redstack'], 'message': "Check for existence of screen before start/stop

Running devstack in the devstack gate environment doesn't
create a screen for the running services. This causes the start,
and stop screen functions in redstack to fail. Fix this by only
performing the start and stop functions if a screen exists.

Partial-bug: 1386337
Change-Id: I2a87e7409575d1000286a7a3742d29a9cc877a8e
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Check for existence of screen before start/stop

Running devstack in the devstack gate environment doesn't
create a screen for the running services. This causes the start,
and stop screen functions in redstack to fail. Fix this by only
performing the start and stop functions if a screen exists.

Partial-bug: 1386337
Change-Id: I2a87e7409575d1000286a7a3742d29a9cc877a8e

commit_message:
Port floating_ips_bulk extention to v2.1

This patch ports floating_ips_bulk extention from v2 to v2.1,
and have v2 unit test cases shared between v2.1 and v2.
Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I9444ff9c394d530cb76dd4ac21b51cd4de7ef6dc

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-22 02:36:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Compute: Catch binding failed exception while init host

While compute starts it will init all instances,
if an exception is raised from one instance
(e.g NovaException during plug_vifs),
then the compute process exits unexpectedly
because of this unhandled exception.
The commit catches the NovaException during
plug_vifs and set instance to error state,
then the compute process can be started normally
even if this exception is raised.

Closes-bug: #1324041

Change-Id: I899fa4947370d7d94fe2b82c71959dea335d8b60
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Compute: Catch binding failed exception while init host

While compute starts it will init all instances,
if an exception is raised from one instance
(e.g NovaException during plug_vifs),
then the compute process exits unexpectedly
because of this unhandled exception.
The commit catches the NovaException during
plug_vifs and set instance to error state,
then the compute process can be started normally
even if this exception is raised.

Closes-bug: #1324041

Change-Id: I899fa4947370d7d94fe2b82c71959dea335d8b60

This simply adds powervm to the list of known hypervisor types which are
validated during scheduling given commit a4fd236.

The powervc-driver in stackforge uses the hypervisor type of 'powervm'
for scheduling so this is needed to make that work now.

There are no unit test changes since not all types are tested.

Given things like bhyve and phyp are already in the list, adding powervm
shouldn't be controversial.

Closes-Bug: #1370613

commit_message:
Translate 'powervm' hypervisor_type to 'phyp' for scheduling

This adds a temporary translation of the 'powervm' hypervisor type
image metadata to 'phyp' for scheduling.

The powervc-driver in stackforge uses the hypervisor type of 'powervm'
for scheduling so this is needed to make that work until the driver
can get a translation shim in place to convert powervm to phyp in
image metadata.

Closes-Bug: #1370613

Change-Id: I4b20ffcb9911806db821f2902e09248dfa89d845

commit_message:
Give a reason why NoValidHost in select_destinations

When we can't schedule an instance build because there are fewer
available hosts than requested number of instances we raise NoValidHost
but don't give a reason.

This change adds a reason and a unit test for the greater-than-zero
NoValidHost case.

Related-Bug: #1372588

Change-Id: Ibd17b3d582b6e1470cd075d73e3dcaa63c9a667e

commit_message:
Sync middleware from oslo-incubator

Returning this outdated code allows grenade jobs not to fall
In all other cases to fix this bug we should have this outdated
code in nova

Closes-Bug: #1383757

commit_message:
Revert "Replace outdated oslo-incubator middleware"

This is breaking the Juno -> master grenade path. As we are using the old
api-paste.ini file which requires the oslo-incubator copy of request_id

This breakage didn't happen from Icehouse -> master since the icehouse
api-paste.ini didn't have request_id as a middleware. request_id is only
used as middleware in the V21/V3 API and not the V2 API.

Closes-Bug: #1383757
This reverts commit 641de5666f38532252e91735a1cd2611d96c489a.

Change-Id: I1ca6bddf9d9370529e999efcc7eae60622e19e6f

commit_message:
Set logging level for glanceclient to WARN

When capturing a snapshot for example, glanceclient logs
the whole uploaded image into the nova compute logs as
glanceclient's log level is set to DEBUG by default

Change-Id: Ie764517c2a4b91cb02c15096f7f0b4138900c92d

commit_message:
Nova should be in charge of its log defaults

Oslo's log module has a set_defaults which Nova can use
to set the context logging format and default log levels.
We should not have to fix default levels in oslo and then
sync across to Nova. This becomes all the more important
when we move to oslo.log library so we should get started
now

Change-Id: Id47099d5a755bc2923b05fe4bef270a7c0f99389

commit_message:
Reduce the complexity of _get_guest_config()

Running flake8 to check for cyclomatic complexity showed that the
libvirt driver's _get_guest_config() method was the worst offender,
with a complexity of 67. This commit simply refactors this method,
splitting off nested cases into their own methods, and reduces the
complextity to 40. No functional changes are included.

Change-Id: Ic27e091f922118edb48b233fb31c702d9528bb75

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-20 11:04:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt: add flag to specify the bootloader to use

Using libvirt + xen, if libvirt is using libxl (the default toolstack
for Xen, since xend is deprecated from Xen 4.1) the bootloader is
harcoded to "/usr/bin/pygrub" [1]. In Debian and Ubuntu pygrub is installed
in /usr/lib/xen-<version>/bin/pygrub. OpenStack does not specify a
bootloader in the 'libvirt.xml' files generated for each instance therefore,
booting a machine with libivrt + xen using libxenlight (libxl) in OpenStack
is not possible.

This change introduces a new flag [libvirt]/xen_bootloader_path that can
be used to specify the correct path to the bootloader.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1104695

on the system.

Xen supports two bootloaders: 'pvgrub' and 'pygrub'. Normally they are

commit_message:
libvirt: add xen bootloader discovery

Using libvirt + xen, when an instance is created without a kernel, a
bootloader should be provided. Currently OpenStack does not set it,
theferore the libvirt XML file does not contain this tag. in these
cases, libvirt will set a default bootloader, thay may or may not exist
on the system.

Xen supports two bootloaders: 'pvgrub' and 'pygrub'. Normally they are
installed in '/usr/bin/' but in some distributions such as Ubuntu and
Debian they are installed under '/usr/libexec/xen-MAJOR.MINOR/bin'.

This change tries to get the best available bootloader in the host, so
that no further configuration is needed by the operator, i.e. if they
set [libvirt]/virt_type=xen they do not need to configure the
bootloader, but nova will choose the best available option.

Change-Id: I9b5ab2f9d54c73b013c2eacce79e55f5f8b986e5

commit_message:
Create links to the HOT reference

Enable and use the os-doc-tools sphinx extension to create links to the
HOT reference resources documentation.

commit_message:
Provider Segment Support for Cisco Nexus Switches

This spec describes the work being done by the blueprint
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/ \
ml2-cisco-nexus-mechdriver-providernet
which implements ML2 provider segment support
for the Cisco 3K, 5K and 7K Nexus switches.

Change-Id: I733b007f629e601101ba2938fecc734deef7d5a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-28 21:28:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixes bad performance when editing project members

The bug is caused by consecutive client calls when
fetching users' roles in a project.

The fix was to use the /v3/role_assignments endpoint.
Which retrieves all roles in a single client call
(dashboards/admin/projects/workflows.py:
UpdateProjectGroupsAction and UpdateProjectUsersAction).

The compatibility to the previous keystoneclient version
is maintained.

In a scenario with 1000 users with a role in a project
(using devstack), the time to render the Modify Users
page dropped from 45s to 2.5s

commit_message:
Fixes bad performance when editing project members

The bug is caused by consecutive client calls when
fetching users' roles in a project.

The fix was to use the /v3/role_assignments endpoint.
Which retrieves all roles in a single client call
(dashboards/admin/projects/workflows.py:
UpdateProjectGroupsAction and UpdateProjectUsersAction).

The compatibility to the previous keystoneclient version
is maintained.

In a scenario with 1000 users with a role in a project
(using devstack), the time to render the Modify Users
page dropped from 45s to 2.5s

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/projects/tests.py

NOTE(jpomero): The conflict is because of a signature change
to one of the project test methods.

Change-Id: Ic72ebea0db226faf98c5e04d00d76dedd1fb01c1
Closes-bug: #1278920
(cherry picked from commit ed43be0a0f40c4b065472da27e6ef6e59a6789ca)

[{'created': '2014-07-23 21:34:35.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/tabs/base.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/flavors/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/usage/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/aggregates/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/cinder.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/tabs.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/instances/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/hypervisors/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/info/tabs.py', 'horizon/exceptions.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/images/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Tolerate service catalog and endpoint connection errors

This is a fix for the issues encountered when a service is not
configured or a service endpoint is not reachable. This fix
will add tolerance for these errors so that an error message is
displayed but the dashboard page will still load, not an error page.
This makes it easier for the user to recover by allowing them to
go to a different page, select a different region, or logout. This
makes sense in many cases such as when a region only contains an
image service endpoint, or when a single endpoint is not reachable
for whatever reason.

It also adds permissions to the panels that require compute or
image services so that the dashboard will not display them if
the service is not configured.

To test these changes you will need to set up your keystone service
catalog so that not all services are available in all regions, or
some of the service endpoints are not reachable.

Change-Id: Ie04699d1fb1d4db13a7f4dcf1bdfd23bf21aab80
Closes-Bug: 1323811
Closes-Bug: 1207636
(cherry picked from commit 407c17b38a05580ea2117e215efa86c541b584f6)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Tolerate service catalog and endpoint connection errors

This is a fix for the issues encountered when a service is not
configured or a service endpoint is not reachable. This fix
will add tolerance for these errors so that an error message is
displayed but the dashboard page will still load, not an error page.
This makes it easier for the user to recover by allowing them to
go to a different page, select a different region, or logout. This
makes sense in many cases such as when a region only contains an
image service endpoint, or when a single endpoint is not reachable
for whatever reason.

It also adds permissions to the panels that require compute or
image services so that the dashboard will not display them if
the service is not configured.

To test these changes you will need to set up your keystone service
catalog so that not all services are available in all regions, or
some of the service endpoints are not reachable.

Change-Id: Ie04699d1fb1d4db13a7f4dcf1bdfd23bf21aab80
Closes-Bug: 1323811
Closes-Bug: 1207636
(cherry picked from commit 407c17b38a05580ea2117e215efa86c541b584f6)

commit_message:
Preserve services region when switching projects

This fixes the issue where the services region might be changed
when switching projects. The new user object will get the same
services region that was being used previously.

Closes-Bug: #1357047
Change-Id: Iefcc8acf482e2ccbcd8cce202a417e5a0a587399
